foods.name: Dosa and Idli
foods.description: Dosa and Idli are popular fermented rice and lentil-based dishes served as breakfast items in Tamil Nadu. They are often accompanied by sambar, a lentil-based vegetable stew, and various chutneys.

foods.name: Chettinad Cuisine
foods.description: Chettinad Cuisine, originating from the Chettinad region, is known for its spicy and flavorful dishes. Chicken Chettinad, Chettinad Fish Curry, and Chettinad Pepper Chicken are some of the signature dishes.

foods.name: Pongal
foods.description: Pongal is a traditional dish made from rice and lentils, seasoned with pepper, cumin, and ghee. It is often served as a savory breakfast dish during the harvest festival of Pongal.

foods.name: Appam with Stew
foods.description: Appam is a soft, fluffy pancake made from fermented rice batter and coconut milk. It is typically served with a creamy stew made from vegetables, meat, or fish.

foods.name: Fish Curry
foods.description: Fish Curry is a staple dish in Kerala, made with fresh catch, coconut milk, and a blend of spices. It is often served with steamed rice or appam.

foods.name: Puttu and Kadala Curry
foods.description: Puttu is a steamed rice cake layered with grated coconut, served with kadala curry, a spicy black chickpea curry cooked with coconut milk and spices.

foods.name: Bisi Bele Bath
foods.description: Bisi Bele Bath is a flavorful rice-based dish cooked with lentils, vegetables, tamarind, and a special blend of spices. It is a wholesome and satisfying one-pot meal, often served with a dollop of ghee and crispy fried papad.

foods.name: Mysore Masala Dosa
foods.description: Mysore Masala Dosa is a crispy dosa smeared with a spicy red chutney made from dried red chilies, garlic, and spices, and stuffed with a savory potato filling. It is a popular breakfast item in Karnataka.

foods.name: Ragi Mudde
foods.description: Ragi Mudde is a nutritious staple food of Karnataka, made from ragi flour (finger millet) and water. It is cooked to a thick consistency and rolled into soft balls, often served with sambar or spicy chutney.
